name: High-Intensity Interval Training (HIIT)
description: HIIT workouts involve short bursts of intense exercises followed by brief rest or low-intensity recovery periods. For example, you could do 30 seconds of jumping jacks, followed by 30 seconds of rest, and then repeat the cycle for 15-20 minutes. HIIT is excellent for burning calories, improving cardiovascular health, and increasing endurance.

name: Bodyweight Circuit Workout
description: This workout utilizes your body weight for resistance. A circuit typically includes exercises like push-ups, squats, lunges, planks, and burpees. Perform each exercise for 45 seconds, followed by 15 seconds of rest. Complete the entire circuit, rest for 1-2 minutes, and then repeat for 3-4 rounds. Bodyweight circuits improve overall strength, endurance, and flexibility.

name: Yoga and Stretching Routine
description: Yoga combines physical postures, breathing exercises, and meditation. A typical yoga routine includes poses like downward dog, warrior poses, and child's pose. Incorporate stretching exercises to improve flexibility and balance. Yoga enhances flexibility, balance, and mental relaxation.

name: Circuit Training with Weights
description: Use dumbbells or kettlebells for this workout. Create a circuit with exercises like bicep curls, shoulder presses, squats with weights, and bent-over rows. Perform 3 sets of 12-15 repetitions for each exercise with minimal rest between sets. Circuit training with weights builds muscle strength and endurance.

name: Outdoor Cardio Workout
description: Take your workout outdoors for a refreshing experience. Jog or briskly walk in the park, interspersed with bodyweight exercises like push-ups, lunges, and jumping jacks. Use a park bench for step-ups and tricep dips. Aim for 30 minutes of continuous activity. Outdoor workouts provide fresh air, boost mood, and enhance cardiovascular health.
